meanings.definition: The way in which something is arranged or set out.
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained the format of the test to the students.
meanings.sent2: The book follows a specific format with chapters and subheadings.
meanings.sent3: The format of the puzzle was so confusing that no one could solve it.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork challenged the traditional format of painting by using unconventional materials.
meanings.sent5: The format of the recipe made it easy for even beginners to follow along.

meanings.definition: To arrange or set out something in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: She needed to format the document before printing it out.
meanings.sent2: Please format the text in bold for emphasis.
meanings.sent3: He decided to format his room in a way that maximized space.
meanings.sent4: The team had to format their presentation to fit the time limit.
meanings.sent5: It is important to format your resume in a professional manner for job applications.
